content: star wars inspired lightsabers by andy s cozy crochet this pattern makes a one piece lightsaber with no sewing involved if used with worsted weight yarn and a size 4 00mm hook it will be about 9 inches long supplies worsted weight yarn medium/size 4 in light grey black a small scrap of red for the button and the blade colour blue or red even yellow or green size 4 00mm hook g yarn needle stitch marker fiberfil or polyfil notes * this is done in amigurumi style make sure your gauge is tight enough so stuffing doesn t show through but not so tight that you can t stick your hook through use an appropriate hook size to reach the appropriate gauge * it is worked in continuous rounds unless otherwise stated in the beginning row where it will state join in the instructions * i always use an invisible sometimes called seamless join when ending one yarn colour and pull up a loop and chain 1 to start the next colour this smoothes and evens out the row so there is not such a noticeable colour change in the row * this pattern is written with the assumption you know how to do the techniques mentioned if you are unfamiliar with any there are lots of online resources on how to do them abbreviations american terminology magic_ring magic_ring single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet sl slip_stitch increase increase decrease decrease st/sts stitch/stitches flo front loops only blo back loops only bpsc back post single_crochet this will make more of a defined edge as opposed to using blo **normally you may sell items made from my patterns as long as you credit andy s cozy crochet as the pattern creator please note that star wars items and characters are protected by copyright and therefore it is illegal to sell or make a profit from such items please make these items for either your own use or as gifts or sell at your own risk the pattern for the blue lightsaber pictured the handle starting with light grey r1 magic_ring 6 single_crochet join r2 increase around 12 single_crochet join r3 bpsc 12 single_crochet r4- 5 single_crochet around 12 single_crochet fasten_off weave in ends as you go switch to black r6 8 single_crochet around 12 single_crochet fasten_off *if you follow the pattern as written then the center for the button will be the fourth stitch of row 7 you can place it now just a few backstitched lines with red or later if you re unsure of the center switch to light grey r9 14 single_crochet around 12 single_crochet after a few rounds we will start to surface crochet add in sl sts of black between the row starting in the first st of r9 and work both colours alternating between as you complete rounds if you re like me then your sl sts are tighter than single_crochet sts so this
